channel.title: Unusual request with possible awesome repercussions
channel.description:
Alright, so I had this idea while I was bored at work:
A t-shirt design of Terminator's robotic hand doing the Vulcan hand-sign whilst holding a lightsaber (could also be a crowbar) and wearing a Green Lantern ring. The caption would read "So say we all."
Now, I don't even pretend to be an artist. I can barely draw anything and my creativity only shows itself very rarely, so what I ask if anyone would be willing to draw this for me and then I would pitch the design to a t-shirt company.
Of course, something like this might have been made before but I can't honestly be arsed to search for it.
Do you think this would be possible to do?

item.title: Unusual request with possible awesome repercussions
item.dc:creator: DrGonzo
item.description:
This T-shirt would be great. Then I would know who to punch or shout abuse at.

Read full topic
item.source: Unusual request with possible awesome repercussions

item.title: Unusual request with possible awesome repercussions
item.dc:creator: Fnoigy
item.description:
bigfan421:

IMO McG Ruined the franchise with Salvation.
If audiences had been left with “The Sarah Connor Chronicles” I think the Terminator franchise would’ve held together… BUT NOOOO, we couldn’t just leave it at the third movie and be done with it.

Wah wah! MY FRANCHISE! :’(:’( Get over it, Salvation was a fun movie, and Terminator 2 was really corny and almost embarrassing at times if you think about it.

Also, I think the shirt idea is too damn much, and I’m not somebody who should ever have to say that.

Read full topic
item.source: Unusual request with possible awesome repercussions

item.title: Unusual request with possible awesome repercussions
item.dc:creator: bigfan421
item.description:
IMO McG Ruined the franchise with Salvation.
If audiences had been left with “The Sarah Connor Chronicles” I think the Terminator franchise would’ve held together… BUT NOOOO, we couldn’t just leave it at the third movie and be done with it.

Back on topic, If an image of such a combination of geek fandome were to be done, I’d say it should be the Comic-con symbol.
I do have one addition, an Autobot symbol on the blade end of the lightsaber, and a Decepticon symbol on the base of the hilt.

Read full topic
item.source: Unusual request with possible awesome repercussions

item.title: Unusual request with possible awesome repercussions
item.dc:creator: Harry-UK
item.description:
mattemuse:

…on the other hand…

I see what you did there.

I’m so tempted to make this image now…unfortunately I’m going on holiday in 8 hours and am in dire need of sleep.

Read full topic
item.source: Unusual request with possible awesome repercussions

item.title: Unusual request with possible awesome repercussions
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
It’s supposed to be a clusterfuck of geekness, with a message of union between geeks.

Together we shall be stronger.

Also, the Terminator hand represents the franchise as a whole and not just T2.

Read full topic
item.source: Unusual request with possible awesome repercussions

item.title: Unusual request with possible awesome repercussions
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
ErikKiller:

Nah just a super nerdy T-shirt.

i don’t really associate Terminator 2 with nerds, really. it’s a big-budget hollywood action film directed by James Cameron and widely considered a classic. And honestly i don’t know that there’s any overlap between Green lantern fans, Star wars nerds, Star trek nerds, etc - in fact they seem to segregate themselves - so the caption “so say we all” seems unlikely. Aside from the fact that the only thing being “said” would be “live long and prosper” which doesn’t make any sense in context.

On the other hand i’d like to see a recreation of the T-2 hand sinking into the lava pit, but it has two thumbs and it’s holding a peyote button, and the caption would be “Too weird to live, too rare to die.” Don’t try to rip me off, I’m copyrighting that shit, bitches.

Read full topic
item.source: Unusual request with possible awesome repercussions

item.title: Unusual request with possible awesome repercussions
item.dc:creator: Maverix26
item.description:
Or you can cut the crap and just go to your local mall, custom print it on your favorite t-shirt, and show all your friends how cool you look with it :retard:

Read full topic

i dont get it… is it supposed to be funny somehow? or just a shirt with movie references?

Nah just a super nerdy T-shirt.

item.source: Unusual request with possible awesome repercussions

item.title: Unusual request with possible awesome repercussions
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
You won’t run into trouble unless you include names or logos.

Look at the TeeFury forum. You can find a designer that will probably do it. They’ll submit it themselves or let you do it.

You get 1 dollar for each shirt, and you’ll split the money with whoever makes it for you.

I’d do it but I’ve got other things to do.

Read full topic
item.source: Unusual request with possible awesome repercussions

item.description:
I would buy it.
